Join host Jason Weiser as we reveal The Lost Pages of Norse Myth.
Discover lore from the new Norse world of God of War, alongside interviews with Santa Monica Studio.
Join host Jason Weiser as we reveal The Lost Pages of Norse Myth.
Discover lore from the new Norse world of God of War, alongside interviews with Santa Monica Studio.
In the last Lost Page, Odin attempts to prevent the apocalypse, destroying the reams and his personal relationships in the process.
Stay tuned after the story for a conversation between Creative Director Cory Barlog, Chris Judge (Kratos), and Sunny Suljic (Atreus).
The eighth Lost Page of Norse Myth tells a tale of long ago: The First Great War.
Tensions between the Vanir and Aesir had been simmering for centuries when the two sides finally tipped into all-out war.
After the story, keep listening for an interview with God of Warâ€™s Senior Systems Designer Anthony Dimento, and Lead Level Designer Luis Sanchez.
The seventh Lost Page illuminates the origin of a most magnificent temple.
Attempting to unite the realms, TÃ½r constructed a new way to travel between them. But his plans go awry, and his best builders seal themselves away forever.
After the story, stay tuned for a chat with Nate Stephens, Lead Environment Artist, and Luke Berliner, Lead Environment Concept Artist.
The sixth Lost Page tells the tale of young Atreus on his first journey away from the protected woods near his home.
Following the pained cries of a wounded animal, the boy finds himself lost in Midgard's woods--and in imminent danger.
Keep listening after the story for an interview about Atreus and Kratos with Story Lead Matt Sophos and Senior Narrative Designer Richard Gaubert.
The fifth Lost Pages of Norse Myth unveils the origins of the Leviathan Axe.
As the Aesir wage their endless war, Dwarven brothers Brok and Sindri begin crafting a new weapon to restore balance to the realmsâ€”at great peril to themselves.
Stay tuned after the story to hear an interview with Jason McDonald, Lead Gameplay Designer, and Jeet Shroff, Lead Gameplay Engineer.
The fourth Lost Page of Norse Myth tells the tale of the Dead Stone Mason.
Thamur, a giant, was the greatest builder the realms had ever known. Until he encountered Thor, the great destroyer.
Stay tuned after the story for a conversation about the score of the game with composer Bear McCreary.

In the third Lost Page, we explore the origin story of the Draugrâ€”one of Midgardâ€™s most horrific creatures. Now it spreads
                                violence to all it encounters, but this monster was once a man.

Stay tuned after the story for a conversation with God of Warâ€™s Principal Character Artist Rafael Grassetti and Principal
                                Animator Bruno Velazquez.

In the second Lost Page of Norse Myth, the oracle Groa desires to see far enough to find her love. But she discovers that
                                knowledge comes at a cost when Odin the All-Father covets her gift of foresight.
Then, stay tuned for a behind-the-scenes chat with God of Warâ€™s Creative Director Cory Barlog and Story Lead Matt Sophos.

It is whisperedthese pages tell the saga of a vengeful god from a distant land, traveling the Realms with his
